tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Oh... I missed that part, my bad. But the reason i brought up Bran wasn't to say he was a traditional feminine sister,...
question: Oh... I missed that part, my bad. But the reason i brought up Bran wasn't to say he was a traditional feminine sister, obviously. It was more like when you said Bran didn't want to hang out with Sansa or Arya bc they're girls. Canon showed he like stories of the south just as much as Sansa, and he did play with Sansa and Arya too.
answer: Sansa definitely has a positive relationship with Bran. It is implied that they spend time to listen to stories together, and there’s even a scene where we get Bran recalling an advice that Sansa gave him. I would honestly love to see them think about each other more since Bran seems to be the sibling that Sansa is the most attached to. All of Sansa’s thoughts about Bran have been completely positive. Sansa dreamed of him smiling, she stated that she has used up all of her tears crying due to his fall (and Lady’s execution), she thinks of Bran when she sees Tommen, he’s one of the many people that she thinks of when she sings before the battle of the black water, she wants to name one of her sons after him, she describes him as being sweet and stated that everyone loved him, and she thinks of a time where she played in the snow with him and Arya. Clearly she loved him, and it’s clear that they’ve spent some time together. That being said, when Bran thinks of people to hang out with after his father and Robert left Winterfell to go hunt, he states not wanting to hang out with Rickon because he was a baby, and not wanting to hang out with Sansa and Arya because they were ‘’only girls’’. Also, he calls the stories that Sansa likes to hear ‘’stupid’’. I never said that they had a bad relationship, but that GRRM didn’t give Sansa a sibling that she has a tight-knit relationship with (at least not in the same wavelength as Jon’s relationship with Robb/Arya/Bran) nor did he give her a sibling that she could enjoy the more feminine-coded things she liked with. That being said, I do love this relationship and I am excited to see them interact with each other after they reunite.

Also, he calls the stories that Sansa likes to hear ‘’stupid’’. I never said that they had a bad relationship, but that GRRM didn’t give Sansa a sibling that she has a tight-knit relationship with (at least not in the same wavelength as Jon’s relationship with Robb/Arya/Bran) nor did he give her a sibling that she could enjoy the more feminine-coded things she liked with. That being said, I do love this relationship and I am excited to see them interact with each other after they reunite.

tags: เกมล่าบัลลังก์
summary: Bran Stark Will Win 'Game of Thrones'—But Not By Becoming King
title: Bran Stark Will Win 'Game of Thrones'—But Not By Becoming King
excerpt: The Three-Eyed Raven has a different destiny.
description:
Any of several GoT characters could wind up as the ultimate hero in the context of Joseph Campbell’s monomyth. We won’t really know for sure until we’ve seen S08E06 (if even then). But Bran seems closer than the others; Jon has risen from the dead, Daenerys mastered fire & dragonry, and Arya can temporarily take on the identities of those she kills. But Bran returns from Beyond the Wall transformed into somebody new – or at the very least, a type of symbiont.

Of course GoT has always been rather unconventional. George R.R. Martin and the showrunners may have a much different take on the concept of the monomyth. The multiple storylines could possibly indicate a multiple set of winners. But there does seem to be something special in store for Bran in particular. Bran could be viewed as a more supernatural equivalent of Luke Skywalker.

summary: I hope after seeing GOT S8, it lights a fire under GRRM's ass to finish TWOW asap and start writing ADOS. We can't be left with...
body: I hope after seeing GOT S8, it lights a fire under GRRM’s ass to finish TWOW asap and start writing ADOS. We can’t be left with D&D’s version of Arya and Bran. It would be horrible if the show’s ending it’s the only one we got. They deserve better and we deserve better than the crap the show has dished out. They are 2 of the series main characters and are treated like 2nd and 3rd tier characters.

summary: Concept: Game Of Thrones ASOUE AU
body:
Concept: Game Of Thrones ASOUE AU

Arya, Bran and Rickon Stark have lived very pleasant lives so far, in a lovely house with their loving parents. The three children are intelligent and talented in the arts of invention, reading and biting, respectively. All in all, they live great lives, and there’s no reason for them to not continue to do so.

At least, until a fire breaks out at Winterfell Mansion, where the Stark family lives. This fire claims the lives of Eddard and Catelyn Stark, and leaves their children orphaned and homeless.

With their finances in the hands of Mr. Tyrell, a banker of questionable usefulness, the three orphans are packed off to live with a distant relative, Count Petyr. Count Petyr is a dreadful actor with a troupe of dreadful cohorts, and a sinister plan to claim the Stark fortune.

After his scheme is foiled, the Starks are passed on to a string of other locations- including Uncle Syrio, a Braavosi herpetologist they’ve never met, who offers a brief period of happiness for the children, Aunt Lysa, an unstable, grammar-obsessed widow, who has lived alone in a crumbling old house known as the Eyrie ever since the death of her husband and son, and, strangely, a lumber mill.

At every turn, though, Count Petyr and his cohorts turn up in disguise, Mr. Tyrell fails to be of any use, and the same questions are raised again and again. Why did the Stark mansion burn down? What is the connection between the guardians the children are placed under? Who is Count Petyr, and why is he so awful? And who is the narrator of this tragic tale, Tyrion Lannister? How does he fit into all of this?

What is the connection between the guardians the children are placed under? Who is Count Petyr, and why is he so awful? And who is the narrator of this tragic tale, Tyrion Lannister? How does he fit into all of this?

summary: If D*ny does burn WF on purpose or by accident, do you think Bran will save everyone via warging the dragon?
question: If D*ny does burn WF on purpose or by accident, do you think Bran will save everyone via warging the dragon?
answer:
Interestingly despite being the only warg, the possibility of it hasn’t been brought up once. I do think it’s entirely possible if the theory that Dany isn’t part of the battle is true, bran could warg into a dragon to save everyone. the only problem here is that if jon does ride a dragon, then so far only targaryens have had control over dragons. bran is a stark so d&d might not consider the possibility.

i am hoping we see bran unleash his powers because we know he is very powerful. i’m tired of d&d making him focus on jon.

summary: we don’t talk about this often but bran really went through hell. he watched people he knew his entire life die, then his home...
body:
we don’t talk about this often but bran really went through hell. he watched people he knew his entire life die, then his home got destroyed and as he journeyed to become the three eyed raven, one by one all his companions except meera died. finally and most horrifying of all, he saw everything that ever happened to everyone from rape to murder to abuse to genocide. every horrible thing that has ever happened now lives in his head. no wonder he shut down. emotional disassociation is real thing that often happens to people who are overloaded with emotions due to trauma or severe mental illness.

if d&d weren’t such ableist pricks, they would have highlighted this.
